intro: Leandra pubescens var. tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly leandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its hairy, grayish foliage and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
